text: to spot a gravitational wave LIGO
physicists will try to detect a
stretching of space itself they will use
this enormous interferometer in
Livingston Louisiana and its twin in
Hanford Washington each facility has
arms for kilometres long laser light
bounces between massive mirrors at the
ends of each arm to look for the
stretching of space physicists compared
the lengths of the arms using a
technique called interferometry if a
gravitational wave stretches the arms by
different amounts light will be diverted
to a photo detector the arms are as long
as an airport runway but researchers
will have to compare their lengths to
within a billion of the width of an atom
and to do that they will have to damp
out all sorts of bigger vibrations
including the sound of distant surf a
rumble from trains on nearby tracks and
the shaking caused by small earthquakes
